dmca.title: [Fwd: FW: Notice of Copyright Infringement/DMCA Take Down Demand per 17 USC 512 (c)]
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Justin Schlecter [mailto:justin@upsideout.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, January 16, 2007 1:35 PM
To: Legal Response
Cc: DMCA
Subject: Re: [Fwd: FW: Notice of Copyright Infringement/DMCA Take Down
Demand per 17 USC 512 (c)]

Attention: Legal Department

Dear Sir or Madam,

The infringing material continues to be accessible in the location that
we identified in our previous letter.

<http://www.bitextra.com/articles-detail-30.html>

The Digital Millennium Copyright Act provides that an Online Service
Provider ("OSP") of an Information Location Tool shall enjoy safe harbor
from liability for copyright infringement if the service provider, "upon
notification of claimed infringement as described in subsection
(c)(iii), responds expeditiously to remove, or disable access to, the
material that is claimed to be infringing or to be the subject of
infringing activity, except that, for purposes of this paragraph, the
information described in (c)(3)(A)(iii) shall be identification of the
reference or link, to material or activity claimed to be infringing,
that is to be removed or access to which is to be disabled, and
information reasonably sufficient to pennit the service provider to
locate that reference or link." 17 U.S.C. 512(d)(3).

Our previous letter (included below) constituted notification of claimed
infringement. Accordingly, UpsideOut, Inc. demands that you act
expeditiously to remove, or disable access to, the web page listed above
in order for you to claim a safe harbor under the DMCA from liability
for contributory and vicarious copyright infringement.  
Please immediately delete or disable access to this web page and remove
its contents from view. Thank you.

Sincerely,

Justin Schlecter
UpsideOut, Inc.
(888) 465-0216 ext 4




On Jan 15, 2007, at 12:07 PM, The Planet Legal Response Team wrote:

> We are unable to locate on the web page 
> http://www.bitextra.com/articlesdetail-30.html any of the material 
> that you claim is being infringed as of  11:07 AM --600 (Central 
> Standard Time), Monday, January 15  2007.
>
>
> --
> The Planet-EV1 Legal Response Team
> https://www.theplanet.com/index.html?p=legal
> (214)782-7800 :: 1-800-377-6103
> Fax:: (214) 782-7756
>
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Justin Schlecter [mailto:justin@upsideout.com]
> Sent: Sunday, January 14, 2007 6:09 PM
> To: DMCA
> Subject: Notice of Copyright Infringement/DMCA Take Down Demand per 17

> USC 512 (c)
>
> Attention: Legal Department
>
> Dear Sir or Madam,
>
> I am writing to file a notice of copyright infringement in accordance 
> with the Digital Millennium Copyright Act.
>
> 1. The copyrighted work at issue is the text that appears on "http:// 
> www.websitepromotioncentral.com/web_design_mistakes.html". Website 
> Promotion Central is a wholly owned subsidiary of UpsideOut, Inc.
>
> 2. The material that we believe is infringing the copyrighted work 
> listed in item #1 appears on "http://www.bitextra.com/articles-
> detail-30.html" which is located at IP address "70.86.16.246". This 
> material is copied in it's entirety.
>
> 3. My contact information:
> Name: Justin Schlecter
> Company: UpsideOut, Inc.
> Address: 1333A North Avenue, Suite 315, New Rochelle, NY 10804
> Phone: (888) 465-0216 ext 4
> Email: justin@upsideout.com
>
>
> 4. Contact information for the owner of the allegedly infringing
> material:
>      BiT Extra Web Solutions
>      Hasan Saleem        (info@bitextra.com)
>      Office number 4-7, T Block
>      First Floor, Trust Plaza, Model Town
>      Gujranwala
>      Punjab,52250
>      PK
>      Tel. +92.3008645499
>      Fax. +92.553258560
>
>
> 5. I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials 
> described above as allegedly infringing is not authorized by the 
> copyright owner, its agent, or the law.
>
> 6. I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the 
> notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or am 
> authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is

> allegedly infringed.
>
> Signed,
> Justin Schlecter, President
> UpsideOut, Inc.
> (888) 465-0216 ext 4
